tips.text: I love it - great place to play with your kids. I was on the swings, the exercise section & played soccer on the field. Can't wait for the rollerskating rink to open.
Sun bathing his highly recommended
One of the best views of Manhattan and the Brooklyn Bridge.  This long path is perfect for a romantic walk after dinner, just don't forget to stop and gaze at the beautiful NYC skyline.
I have never worn skinny jeans, but if I did I would wear them here.

user.firstName: The Most Interesting Man in the World

tips.text: All the ice creams here are made with dairy from an organic dairy cooperative in Lancaster, Pennsylvania.
Many types of birds and crustaceans have made themselves at home in the salt marsh at Pier 1.  We can't blame them- the view is spectacular!

location.address: Fulton Ferry Landing to Atlantic Ave.
formattedAddress: Fulton Ferry Landing to Atlantic Ave.

tips.text: Have a picnic here!
Such a pretty view! If you have friends or family visiting bring them here! This is also a great place for a run when the weather permits.
Great location for a New York City sunset.
Ahhh, BQE fumes...stop at Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory on your way home!
Free concert every Saturday at 3, beautiful setting
PHOTO: Did you know the house from "Moonstruck" is right down the block at 19 Cranberry?  Here's Cher and Nicholas Cage on the set in 1987, at the link!
Bring your tray and eat out front or get your food to go and eat in Brooklyn Bridge Park. Beautiful views of Manhattan complete with your Shack burger.
Great areas of shade in picnic peninsula thanks to some sail/tarps.
Michael Psilakis cools off at the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory in where they serve up a scoop of Butter Pecan Ice Cream on Food Network's The Best Thing I Ever Ate. Find more tips at FN Local.
♫"You better be careful when you cross that bridge."♩-'Lil KIM
Great view great soccer great people
Send a child ahead to wait in [the always long] line. If they really want an ice cream, they'll do it.
Outstanding. And the smalls are hardly small: 16 inches. (A large is 18")
Enjoy the gorgeous views of Manhattan and solid American cuisine but avoid the special occasion crowds by having lunch at the River Café.  - Inspector
Favorite freelancer spot. Great coffee, good tunes, strong wifi, lovely staff. Stay all day! They serve beer & wine, too.
Don't let the subway station locale fool you...good sushi by a cute husband wife team. Try the sashimi version of bi bim bop.
Best pizza in Brooklyn Heights
Show up early (especially if the weather is nice)! The wait is about two hours by 2pm.
Come here in 2012, when it's still undiscovered and not crowded.
Get the $10 salad platter where you can choose 5 appetizers. Loved the iced mint tea and outdoor seating. Great service!
This lively eatery pulls in Brooklynites looking for both homey abuela standbys (rich, cilantro-nipped guac; fragrant pozole verde) and palate-expanding fare (tongue tacos, duck-leg tamales).
Catch N before he sails into the sunset on his boat, The Charlotte. Or go with him—he’s been known to take impromptu trips (and even more impromptu guests) around the island.
Best Lobster roll. Pair with Brooklyn Ice cream for a great eating adventure.
The first phase of improving the East River Waterfront Esplanade was a 2-mile-long, City-owned public open space extending from the Battery Maritime Building to Montgomery Street.
